reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - South Africa - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

participating-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
British Council

title.narrative: R&I Conditions for Grants and Contracts

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Researcher Links Travel Grants September 2014

description.narrative: Travel grants for researchers to build capacity and support research in priority areas

To build sustainable research links between the UK and partner countries and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare.The purpose of the project is to support the development and enhancement of research relationships between South Africa and UK researchers. The results of these relationships will contribute to the enhancement of global connectedness by providing the means for South African and UK researchers to share knowledge and collaborate in joint research programmes. However this project does not provide for mainstream research funds.

title.narrative: Institutional Links December 2014-2016

description.narrative: Grants for research and innovation collaborations between the UK and partner countries to support the translation of research into benefit

To initiate new research and innovation collaborations between academic groups, departments and institutions in partner countries and the UK and support the exchange of research and innovation expertise and the translation of research knowledge into tangible benefits. Target: 4 Institutional Links grants awarded in 2015

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Bilateral Research Chairs (SARCHI) 2015-2021

description.narrative: 2 UK-South Africa (SA) Chairs of Research that will focus on strengthening research and innovation capacities in SA at the highest scientific level with the support of UK institutions which will co-host the Chair

To strengthen research and innovation exchange and capacities in selected research domains that will contribute to economic and social development. It is aimed at retaining and attarcting research excellence with a specific focus on emerging researchers and scientists. Finally to develop career pathways for young and mid-career scientists and increasing the production of Masters and Doctoral graduates in selected research areas.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: PDE: Commercialisation (2015-2018)

description.narrative: There is a severe lack of capacity in Southern Africa with respect to experienced managers/ practitioners/specialists capable of facilitating the process of technology management in the public sector National Systems of Innovation (NSI).

Mode of delivery: through an internship programme comprising of a generic mainstream programme during the first year and specialised stream programme of either technology commercialisation or technology business development in the second year. The target is to train 10 (5 UK, 5 SA) appropriately skilled and experienced commercialisation practitioners by 2016.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: RL Travel Grants (nGAP new generation of academics) July 2016

description.narrative: Under the People Strand, the British Council and the Department of Higher Education and Training (DHET) the Republic of South Africa agree to collaborate within the following programmes that relate specifically to the objective of supporting the new Generation of Academics Programme (nGAP) as outlined in the Staffing South Africa’s Universities Framework (SSAUF). DHET’s nGAP programme aspires to allocate 400 posts across the sector, per annum for six years

The main objective is to provide new Generation of Academics Programme (nGAP) academics an opportunity to undertake mobility exchange programmes that will benefit their academic teaching and learning.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering Mathematics Teacher Education (IRIS CONNECT software)

description.narrative: In order to build strong research and innovation nations, there must be a steady supply of talented students equipped with the knowledge, skills and desire to follow a career in Science, Engineering, Technology and Maths (STEM).

Support dialogue and knowledge exchange between the UK and South Africa around Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering (STEM) education approaches for improved curricula for primary, secondary and tertiary STEM education. • Support development of new and improved pedagogies and teaching and learning resources, relevant to South African context and development need, leading to enhanced capacity for teaching STEM subjects. • Support centres of excellence for STEM education in South Africa through partnerships with UK experts. • Equip students with a better understanding and appreciation of STEM education in an international context
This will mean more students with relevant skills and knowledge pursue a STEM-related career, thus building absorptive capacity for research and innovation in country.

title.narrative: PDE: Science Communication

description.narrative: This programme builds the capacity to communicate research effectively to the general public. . It involves a series of face to face training modules, delivered by experienced trainers and backed up with online resources.
Build the science communication and public enagagement skills of female researchers Build capacity for policy advice Build the researcher's profile as a science communicator

title.narrative: Trilateral Research Chairs (2018-2022)

description.narrative: 3-5 year research partnership between the UK-SA and Africa. 2 UK-SA-Africa trilateral research chairs aiming to imporve research capacity and excellence in Africa, working in collaboration with the UK.

Each chair will support research excellence acrosss the UK-South Africa (SA) and Africa through joint research led by 3 leading and established researchers/ research chairs and capacity building for early career researchers ( mentorship/ mobility, Masters and PhD scholarships)
